name: Hotel Aloha

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for my first trip to Nicaragua and wasn't sure what to excpect, especially since the price was very affordable. The rooms are complete, by Nicaragua standards, having hot water, air conditioning, complimentary bottled water and a free breakfast with cooked to order eggs. The hotel is small, but in this case, it is to the guest's advantage, as all staff members know who you are, and treat every guest as a valued customer. I stayed a week and by the end of the week, I found all the employees were familiar with my routines and preferences and were eager to make sure my stay was nice.
reviews.title: Newer hotel-excellent value, excellent service

reviews.text: The overall look of the hotel and the rooms was nice. TV included cable with many American stations.
reviews.title: B&B with excellent personal service with simple elegance and great location

reviews.text: The location was also excellent...within an easy walking distance to Metrocentro which has modern stores, restaurants. Also a well known landmark if you need to identify the area of town to cab drivers.
reviews.title: Great, small, family run hotel

likes.liked: — It was set in a quiet, safe neighborhood in the center of Managua; the food and service were excellent

reviews.text: The small hotel was a nice "home away from home" as I did all-day excursions each day. Because the hotel is small, and has no pool, it should not be considered a "destination" hotel. If you plan to just hang around, you will probably find it a little boring, but a perfect place if you will be gone touring, on business, etc, and need a place to end and start the day.
reviews.title: Nice service
